name: bag.css
description: The minimal library for fixed and fluid CSS containers.

scripts.release: npm run dist-fixed && npm run dist-fluid && npm run dist-all
scripts.dist-fixed: uglifycss lib/bag.css > dist/bag.fixed.css && uglifycss lib/bag.fixed.css >> dist/bag.fixed.css
scripts.dist-fluid: uglifycss lib/bag.css > dist/bag.fluid.css && uglifycss lib/bag.fluid.css >> dist/bag.fluid.css
scripts.dist-all: uglifycss lib/bag.css > dist/bag.all.css && uglifycss lib/bag.fluid.css >> dist/bag.all.css && uglifycss lib/bag.fixed.css >> dist/bag.all.css

author: Ionică Bizău <bizauionica@gmail.com> (https://ionicabizau.net)

description.p: You don't ndeed monolithic CSS frameworks for simple CSS containers (fluid/fixed). **bag.css** does the job and it weights ~150 bytes. :dizzy:
In the [`dist`](/dist) directory there are three minified files:

ul: `bag.all.css` (164 B): the previous two files' content put together

documentation.p: The `bag.all.css` file handles the semantic classes:

ul: `bag`: that means the element should be a container (fluid or fixed)
`fixed`: together with `bag`, this will create a fixed container (e.g. `<div class="fixed bag").
`fluid`: together with `bag`, this will create a fluid container (e.g. `<div class="fluid bag").
